Package com.graphql_java_generator.plugin

Interface PluginConfiguration

public interface PluginConfiguration
This interface contains all the configuration parameters for the plugin, as an interface.
All these methods are directly the property names, to map against a Spring Configuration that defines the Beans. These beans can then be reused in Spring Component, thank to Spring IoC and its dependency injection capability.
Author:
EtienneSF

  • Method Details

    • getCustomScalars

      java.util.List<CustomScalarDefinition> getCustomScalars()
      List of custom scalars implemented by the project for its GraphQL schema. It's a map, where the key is the scalar name, as defined in the GraphQL schema, and the value is the full class name of the implementation of GraphQLScalarType. Please note that, for each custom scalar defined in the GraphQL schema, the project must implement one GraphQLScalarType, and provide its implementation in the maven pom, with this parameter.

    • getGenerateJPAAnnotation

      boolean getGenerateJPAAnnotation()
      Indicates whether the plugin should generate the JPA annotations, for generated objects, when in server mode. Default value is false

    • getLog

      Logger getLog()
      The logging system to use. It's implemented against the JDK one, to avoid useless dependencies. For instance you can use log4j2, by adding the 'Log4j JDK Logging Adapter' (JUL)

    • getMode

      PluginMode getMode()
      The generation mode: either client or server. Choose client to generate the code which can query a graphql server or server to generate a code for the server side.
      This parameter is mandatory.

    • getPackageName

      java.lang.String getPackageName()
      The packageName in which the generated classes will be created

    • getPackaging

      Packaging getPackaging()
      The packaging is the kind of artefact generated by the project. Typically: jar (for a standard Java application) or war (for a webapp)

    • getSchemaFileFolder

      java.io.File getSchemaFileFolder()
      The main resources folder, typically '/src/main/resources' of the current project. That's where the GraphQL schema(s) are expected to be: in this folder, or one of these subfolders

    • getSchemaFilePattern

      java.lang.String getSchemaFilePattern()
      The pattern to find the graphql schema file(s). The default value is "/*.graphqls" meaning that the maven plugin will search all graphqls files in the "src/main/resources" folder. The current version can read only one file.
      In the future, it will search for all graphqls file in the root of the classpath.
      In the future, it will be possible to set in schemaFilePattern values like "myFolder/*.graphqls" to search for all schemas in the "myFolder" subfolder of src/main/resources (for the plugin execution). At runtime, the path used for search will then be classpath:/myFolder/*.graphqls".
      It will also be possible to define one schema, by putting "mySchema.myOtherExtension" in the schemaFilePattern configuration parameter of the plugin.

    • getSchemaPersonalizationFile

      java.io.File getSchemaPersonalizationFile()
      Gets the Schema personalization file, which allows to override the default code generation behavior. See the plugin doc for more details.
      Returns:

    • getSourceEncoding

      java.lang.String getSourceEncoding()
      The encoding for the generated source files

    • getTargetClassFolder

      java.io.File getTargetClassFolder()
      The folder where the generated classes will be compiled, that is: where the class file are stored after compilation

    • getTargetSourceFolder

      java.io.File getTargetSourceFolder()
      The folder where the generated classes will be generated

    • getTemplates

      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getTemplates()
      The overwritting templates

    • isCopyGraphQLJavaSources

      boolean isCopyGraphQLJavaSources()
      Returns true if shall copy graphql sources (graphql-java-runtime) source code
      Returns:

    • logConfiguration

      default void logConfiguration()
      Logs all the configuration parameters, in the debug level
